subject: History
title: The English Civil War
description: A short lesson to help you apply The English Civil War.

hook.text: In 1649, England did the unthinkable: it put its own king on trial and chopped off his head.

buildup.text: King Charles I believed in divine rightâ€”that God chose him to rule. Parliament violently disagreed.

discovery.text: Oliver Cromwell's New Model Army defeated the royalists in a brutal civil war that killed one in ten Englishmen.

twist.text: Cromwell became Lord Protectorâ€”essentially a military dictator. England traded a king for a tyrant.

climax.text: After Cromwell died, England brought back the monarchy. But kings never held absolute power again.

punchline.text: They killed a king and then wanted one back.

quiz.question: What happened after Cromwell became Lord Protector of England?
options: He ruled as a military dictator until his death
He restored King Charles I to the throne
